content.question: Which of the following is the repeated rhythmic motive heard at the beginning of the melody which also returns at the end of the excerpt?

choices.label: The figure presents one measure and a down beat of music on a staff that has a rhythm clef.
The figure presents one measure and a down beat of music on a staff that has a rhythm clef.
The figure presents one measure and a down beat of music on a staff that has a rhythm clef.
The figure presents one measure and a down beat of music on a staff that has a rhythm clef.

content.answer: The figure presents one measure and a down beat of music on a staff that has a rhythm clef.

unit.text: 2: Music Fundamentals II - Minor Scales and Key Signatures, Melody, Timbre, and Texture

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
